panels.content:
### To choose which measurements to show, use the **Measurements** drop-down in the top left corner!

K6 collects metrics for several phases during the HTTP request lifetime.

The combined delays for the application and network (send, wait, recieve) are available in this metric:
  * **http_req_duration**       _( Total time for request, excluding time spent blocked (http_req_blocked), DNS lookup (http_req_looking_up) and TCP connect (http_req_connecting) time. )_

This metric can also be broken down into these metrics:
  * **http_req_tls_handshaking**     _( Time spent handshaking TLS session with remote host. )_
  * **http_req_sending**      _( Time spent sending data to remote host.  )_
  * **http_req_waiting**      _( Time spent waiting for response from remote host (a.k.a. "time to first byte", or "TTFB"). )_
  * **http_req_receiving**       _( Time spent receiving response data from remote host. )_

These metrics measure delays and durations on the client:

  * **http_req_blocked**     _( Time spent blocked (waiting for a free TCP connection slot) before initiating request.  )_
  * **http_req_looking_up**     _( Time spent looking up remote host name in DNS. )_
  * **http_req_connecting**     _( Time spent establishing TCP connection to remote host. )_


### View official K6.io documentation here: [https://docs.k6.io/docs/result-metrics][1]


[1]: https://docs.k6.io/docs/result-metrics

options.content:
### To choose which measurements to show, use the **Measurements** drop-down in the top left corner!

K6 collects metrics for several phases during the HTTP request lifetime.

The combined delays for the application and network (send, wait, recieve) are available in this metric:
  * **http_req_duration**       _( Total time for request, excluding time spent blocked (http_req_blocked), DNS lookup (http_req_looking_up) and TCP connect (http_req_connecting) time. )_

This metric can also be broken down into these metrics:
  * **http_req_tls_handshaking**     _( Time spent handshaking TLS session with remote host. )_
  * **http_req_sending**      _( Time spent sending data to remote host.  )_
  * **http_req_waiting**      _( Time spent waiting for response from remote host (a.k.a. "time to first byte", or "TTFB"). )_
  * **http_req_receiving**       _( Time spent receiving response data from remote host. )_

These metrics measure delays and durations on the client:

  * **http_req_blocked**     _( Time spent blocked (waiting for a free TCP connection slot) before initiating request.  )_
  * **http_req_looking_up**     _( Time spent looking up remote host name in DNS. )_
  * **http_req_connecting**     _( Time spent establishing TCP connection to remote host. )_


### View official K6.io documentation here: [https://docs.k6.io/docs/result-metrics][1]


[1]: https://docs.k6.io/docs/result-metrics

targets.query: SELECT max("value") FROM /^$Measurement$/ WHERE $timeFilter and value > 0 GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(none)
SELECT percentile("value", 90) FROM /^$Measurement$/ WHERE $timeFilter and value > 0 GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(none)
SELECT median("value") FROM /^$Measurement$/ WHERE $timeFilter and value > 0 GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(none)
SELECT min("value") FROM /^$Measurement$/ WHERE $timeFilter and value > 0 GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(none)
SELECT min("value") FROM $Measurement WHERE $timeFilter and value > 0

SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean("throttling_throttled_time"), 10s)  / 100 FROM "docker_container_cpu" WHERE ("container_name" =~ /^$Container$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(linear)
SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean("fail_count"), 10s) AS "Fail count" FROM "docker_container_mem" WHERE ("container_name" =~ /^$Container$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(linear)

SELECT last("HeapMemoryUsage.max") AS "Heap Limit", mean("HeapMemoryUsage.used") AS "Heap Used", last("NonHeapMemoryUsage.max") AS "NonHeap Limit", mean("NonHeapMemoryUsage.used") AS "NonHeap Used" FROM "java_memory" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$HostId$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(linear)
SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean("fail_count"), 10s) AS "Fail count" FROM "docker_container_mem" WHERE ("container_name" =~ /^$Container$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(linear)

SELECT last("HeapMemoryUsage.max") AS "Heap Limit", mean("HeapMemoryUsage.used") AS "Heap Used", last("NonHeapMemoryUsage.max") AS "NonHeap Limit", mean("NonHeapMemoryUsage.used") AS "NonHeap Used" FROM "java_memory" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$HostId$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(linear)

list.name: Container
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES ON loadtesting WITH KEY = "container_name"

list.name: Agent
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES ON loadtesting WITH KEY = "jolokia_agent_url"
